hanzi-su-wiki:
覇

Значения

Господство, гегемония; господин

Мнемоника

В начале месяца луна 月 растёт, удлиняясь, как намоченная дождём 雨 кожа 革. Так и глава князей обязан только императору своему росту и славе, завися от него как луна от солнца.

Варианты

霸

rtega_mnemonic:
霸霸RS
覇覇		𧟲䩗hegemony, supremacy, leadership, champion
  • person ruling over animals 革 moon 月 west 覀 and rain 雨
heisig_constituent: hegemony, old west, leather, flowers, car, mouth, ten, needle, moon, month, flesh, part of the body
koohiiStory1: In the old west, animal skins were made into leather and their flesh was eaten, thus using the whole animal, which viewed from the animal side could be taken as humans asserting complete hegemony over them. All your base are belong to us.
koohiiStory2: In the Old West, cowboys had hegemony OVER the Indians despite their leathercraft and ability to navigate by the moon.
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Take a leather helicopter to the moon to prove your excellent leadership. Some people called you crazy, but you'll show them, as you lead an entire crew of leather helicopter pilots on their first mission to space!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Not many people have the leadership it takes to lead such a mission. Imagine what it takes to do it!
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: Under your superior leadership you and your leather helicopter crew are able to make it to the moon. The moon! Your crew is so impressed by your leadership, and their lack of being very dead, and they all start laughing, "Ha (は) ha ha ha!" They thought they were going to die but you lead them to the moon safely!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine laughing along with the crew, in awe at your own leadership skills. Ha ha ha! We didn't die!
Kanshudo_mnemonic: in the west (覀) a month (月) and leather (革) lead to domination

Main pronunciation 主要发音: bà

Other pronunciations 其它发音: pò,bà

Original meaning 本义: Meaning (orig) month of birth (now) meaning rule by force.

English senses 英语理解: rule by might rather than right

Usage example 用法举例: 霸道 bà dào (highhanded)

Importance by frequency 常用频率: 1828

覇字的基本解释

覇
bà

覇
pò
均同“霸”。

覇字的汉语字典释义

[①]［bà］
［《廣韻》必駕切，去禡，幫。］
亦作“屰2”。“伯2”的被通假字。亦作“覇1”。
(1)作诸侯联盟的首领；称霸。
(2)引申为称雄，夺冠。
(3)霸主。古代诸侯联盟的首领。
(4)霸道。指凭借武力、刑法、权势等进行统治的政策。与“王道”相对而言。
(5)强行占据。
(6)控制，固定。
(7)强横，霸道。
(8)恶霸。指依仗权势或实力横行一方的人。
(9)水名。源出陕西省蓝田县西北，流入渭水。
(10)姓。
[②]［pò］
［《集韻》匹陌切，入陌，滂。］
指农历每月初始见之月。《说文·月部》：“霸，月始生霸然也。承大月二日，承小月三日。《周書》曰：'哉生霸。'”今本《书·康诰》作“哉生魄”。段玉裁注引《正义》：“前月大，則月二日生魄，前月小，則三日始生魄。”一说，指月未盛明时所发的光。参阅王国维《观堂集林·生霸死霸考》。

覇字的康熙字典解释

【申集下】【襾字部】　覇； 康熙笔画：19； 页码：页1129第10
【廣韻】俗霸字。

覇字的源字形

字形对比：

暂无。

Dominate
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［bà］
["Guangyun" must be cut, go to the 禡, help. ]
Also known as "屰2". "Bo 2" was passed falsely. Also known as "Ba 1".
(1) To be the leader of the vassal alliance; to be hegemonic.
(2) The extension is to rule the roost and win the championship.
(3) Overlord. The leader of the ancient alliance of princes.
(4) Domineering. Refers to the policy of ruling by force, criminal law, power, etc. In contrast to the "kingdom".
(5) Forced occupation.
(6) Control and fix.
(7) Domineering and domineering.
(8) Bully. Refers to a person who relies on power or strength to run rampant on one side.
(9) Water name. It originates from the northwest of Lantian County in Shaanxi Province and flows into Weishui River.
(10) Last name.
[②]［pò］
["Jiyun" cuts through the moss, enters the moss, and frantic. ]
Refers to the first month of the lunar calendar. "Suowen·Yuebu": "Ba, the beginning of the moon is born to be Baran. The second day of the big moon, and the third day of the small moon. "The Book of the Week" says: "Zaisheng Ba."" The current book "Kanggao" As "Zai Shengpu". Duan Yucai's commentary quoted from "Justice": "The first month is big, the second month will be born, and the first month is small, then the third day will be born." One said, referring to the light emitted when the moon is not full. Refer to Wang Guowei's "Guantang Jilin·Study on Life and Death".

bà
вм. 霸
Radicals: 覀, 革, 月  (helicopter, leather, moon)
Meaning Mnemonic
Take a leather helicopter to the moon to prove your excellent leadership. Some people called you crazy, but you'll show them, as you lead an entire crew of leather helicopter pilots on their first mission to space!
Not many people have the leadership it takes to lead such a mission. Imagine what it takes to do it!
Reading Mnemonic
Under your superior leadership you and your leather helicopter crew are able to make it to the moon. The moon! Your crew is so impressed by your leadership, and their lack of being very dead, and they all start laughing, "Ha (は) ha ha ha!" They thought they were going to die but you lead them to the moon safely!
Imagine laughing along with the crew, in awe at your own leadership skills. Ha ha ha! We didn't die!
